raw.title: [BIP-691] Enable gauge for GYD/wstETH E-CLP [Arbitrum]
raw.author: 0x7c2eA10D3e5922ba3bBBafa39Dc0677353D2AF17
raw.body:
PR With Payload:
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/1312

### Summary

This is a proposal to enable one uncapped Balancer gauges on Arbitrum for a GYD/wstETH E-CLP. We propose to only enable protocol fees of 50% once BAL rewards start. Initially, the entire protocol fee revenue will accrue to Balancer.

### References/Useful links

* [Documentation of E-CLPs](https://docs.gyro.finance/gyroscope-protocol/concentrated-liquidity-pools/e-clps)
* [Website](https://gyro.finance/)
* [Github](https://github.com/gyrostable)
* [Discord](https://discord.com/invite/2vnqnS7wE6)
* [X](https://twitter.com/GyroStable)

---

### Protocol description

* GYD is a USD denominated stablecoin, issued by [Gyroscope](https://gyro.finance/).
* wstETH is a static wrapper of stETH. stETH is a yield bearing token that represents staked ether in [Lido](https://help.lido.fi/en/articles/5230610-what-is-steth).

---

### Motivation

Gyroscope is launching further strategic pools.

---

### Specifications

#### Governance

The Gyroscope Protocol will be governed by a DAO and relevant stakeholder with the full launch on Ethereum. For now, the FTL Labs multi-sig can pause the pool, change the swap fee and set the protocol fee. As a custom pool by Gyroscope, the E-CLP will be controlled by Gyroscope governance upon its launch.

#### Oracles
* ‘rateProvider0 for wstETH’: [0xf7c5c26B574063e7b098ed74fAd6779e65E3F836](https://arbiscan.io/address/0xf7c5c26b574063e7b098ed74fad6779e65e3f836#code) and relevant [review](https://github.com/balancer/code-review/blob/main/rate-providers/wstethRateProvider.md).
* ‘rateProvider0’ for GYD: [0x3a216B01db971Bf28D171C9dA44Cc8C89867697F](https://arbiscan.io/address/0x3a216B01db971Bf28D171C9dA44Cc8C89867697F)


#### Audits

Audit reports by Nethermind, Trail of Bits, and Runtime Verification can be accessed here (the E-CLP is called the “CEMM” in these reports). In addition, the E-CLP code has been live in production since November 2022.

#### Centralization vectors

No centralization vectors. The FTL Labs team’s multi-sig can - currently - pause the pool, change the swap fee and set the protocol fee.

#### Market History

* The Gyroscope Protocol is live on Ethereum since EOY23, with E-CLPs on several other chains. Details available [here ](https://dune.com/gyro_finance/gyroscope-e-clps).
* This is the first GYD/ wstETH pool.

## Value

As per “Motivation”.

---

#### Contracts
* E-CLP: [0x596a76a1AE4F7a6055F0C7D4e40737bFc19cFa2c](https://arbiscan.io/address/0x596a76a1AE4F7a6055F0C7D4e40737bFc19cFa2c)
* Child gauge on Arbitrum: [0x44Ab430eFDFf0b6f467f2148a90DC9A8F0ab8D67](https://arbiscan.io/address/0x44Ab430eFDFf0b6f467f2148a90DC9A8F0ab8D67)
* Arbitrum root gauge on Ethereum: [0xC11442Cdbe8901b36aeB7bE7F3f95B6a8ade394e](https://etherscan.io/address/0xC11442Cdbe8901b36aeB7bE7F3f95B6a8ade394e)

---

Specification

Transaction: The Balancer Maxi LM Multisig `eth:0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860` will interact with the gaugeAdderv4 at `0x5DbAd78818D4c8958EfF2d5b95b28385A22113Cd `and call the `addGauge` function with the following arguments:

* gauge(address): `0xC11442Cdbe8901b36aeB7bE7F3f95B6a8ade394e`
* gaugeType(string): `Arbitrum`

choices: No, this is not the way

raw.title: [BIP-692] Enable sDAI/aUSDC.e E-CLP Gauge [Gnosis]
raw.author: 0x7c2eA10D3e5922ba3bBBafa39Dc0677353D2AF17
raw.body:
PR With Payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/1339

**Summary**
> This is a proposal to enable one uncapped Balancer gauge on Gnosis Chain for an sDAI/aUSDC.e E-CLP. 

**References/Useful links**

> Links
> * [Documentation of E-CLPs](https://docs.gyro.finance/gyroscope-protocol/concentrated-liquidity-pools/e-clps)
> * [Website](https://gyro.finance/)
> * [Github](https://github.com/gyrostable)
> * [Discord](https://discord.com/invite/2vnqnS7wE6)
> * [X](https://twitter.com/GyroStable)

**Protocol Description**

> * aUSDC.e is the deposit receipt token issued by the Aave protocol to lenders of bridged USDC. Since aTokens are rebasing, this pool uses BGD Labs’s statA wrapper that is a repricing representation of statA tokens that reflects the accruing lending yield.
> * Savings Dai (sDAI) is a tokenized, yield-bearing representation of Dai deposited in the Dai Savings Rate (DSR) offered by MakerDAO.


**Motivation**

> Gyroscope is launching further strategic pools.

**Specification**
 
>1. **Governance:** The Gyroscope Protocol will be governed by a DAO and relevant stakeholder with the full launch on Ethereum. For now, the FTL Labs multi-sig can pause the pool, change the swap fee and set the protocol fee. As a custom pool by Gyroscope, the E-CLP will be controlled by Gyroscope governance upon its launch.
>
>
>2. **Oracles:** 
> * ‘rateProvider0’: sDAI rate provider on Gnosis Chain: [0x89C80A4540A00b5270347E02e2E144c71da2EceD](https://gnosisscan.io/address/0x89C80A4540A00b5270347E02e2E144c71da2EceD)
and relevant [review ](https://github.com/balancer/code-review/blob/main/rate-providers/SavingsDAIRateProviderGnosis.md).
> *  ‘rateProvider1’: aUSDC.e rate provider on Gnosis Chain: [0x5F62fd24941B585b91EB059E0ea1a7e729357511](https://gnosisscan.io/address/0x5F62fd24941B585b91EB059E0ea1a7e729357511) 
>
>3. **Audits:** Audit reports by Nethermind, Trail of Bits, and Runtime Verification can be accessed here (the E-CLP is called the “CEMM” in these reports). In addition, the E-CLP code has been live in production since November 2022.
>
>4. **Centralization vectors:** No centralization vectors. The FTL Labs team’s multi-sig can - currently - pause the pool, change the swap fee and set the protocol fee.
>
>5. **Market History:** This is the first sDAI/aUSDC.e E-CLP on Gnosis Chain.
>
>6. **Value:** This pool is intended to be the primary source of liquidity for the token(s). 

#### Contracts

> * E-CLP: [0xaa56989Be5E6267fC579919576948DB3e1F10807](https://gnosisscan.io/address/0xaa56989Be5E6267fC579919576948DB3e1F10807)
>* Child Chain Gauge on Gnosis Chain: [0x9ED250d67c4E5F5B2b5F982a678eD1c0ba011207](https://gnosisscan.io/address/0x9ED250d67c4E5F5B2b5F982a678eD1c0ba011207)
>* Root Chain Gauge: [0xc0b75da8E6F6403804EFEFDE3101b02276C5f8EA](https://etherscan.io/address/0xc0b75da8E6F6403804EFEFDE3101b02276C5f8EA)


#### Specification


>Transaction: The Balancer Maxi LM Multisig `eth:0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860` will interact with the GaugeAdderv4 at `0x5DbAd78818D4c8958EfF2d5b95b28385A22113Cd` and call the `addGauge` function with the following arguments:
>
>gauge(address): `0xc0b75da8E6F6403804EFEFDE3101b02276C5f8EA`
>gaugeType(string): `Gnosis`

choices: No, this is not the way

raw.title: [BIP-663] Enable wUSDM/GYD E-CLP gauge [Arbitrum]
raw.author: 0x7c2eA10D3e5922ba3bBBafa39Dc0677353D2AF17
raw.body:
PR with Payload:
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/1172

### Summary 
This is a proposal to enable one uncapped Balancer gauge for a wUSDM/GYD E-CLP on Arbitrum. We propose to only enable protocol fees once rewards start.



### References/Useful links
* [Documentation of E-CLPs](https://docs.gyro.finance/gyroscope-protocol/concentrated-liquidity-pools/e-clps)
* [Website](https://gyro.finance/)
* [Github](https://github.com/gyrostable)
* [Discord](https://discord.com/invite/2vnqnS7wE6)
* [X](https://twitter.com/GyroStable)

---

### Protocol description
* "wUSDM is a wrapped version of USDM. USDM is a USD denominated stablecoin, issued by the [Mountain Protocol](https://mountainprotocol.com/)
* GYD is a USD denominated stablecoin, issued by the [Gyroscope protocol](https://gyro.finance/)
---

### Motivation
Gyroscope is further expanding on Arbitrum and bootstrapping wUSDM/GYD liquidity on Arbitrum with the first respective pool.

---

### Specifications
#### Governance
The Gyroscope Protocol will be governed by a DAO and relevant stakeholder with the full launch on Ethereum. For now, the FTL Labs multi-sig can pause the pool, change the swap fee and set the protocol fee. As a custom pool by Gyroscope, the E-CLP will be controlled by Gyroscope governance upon its launch.

 #### Oracles
- 'rateProvider0': wUSDM rate provider on Arbitrum: [0x7F55E509006C9Df7594C4819Ba7ebfE6EfE4854b](https://arbiscan.io/address/0x7F55E509006C9Df7594C4819Ba7ebfE6EfE4854b) and relevant [review](https://github.com/balancer/code-review/blob/main/rate-providers/wUSDMRateProvider.md).
-  'rateProvider1': GYD rate provider on Arbitrum: 0x00

#### Audits
Audit reports by Nethermind, Trail of Bits, and Runtime Verification can be accessed here (the E-CLP is called the “CEMM” in these reports). In addition, the E-CLP code has been live in production on Polygon since November 2022.

#### Centralization vectors
No centralization vectors. The FTL Labs team’s multi-sig can - currently - pause the pool, change the swap fee and set the protocol fee.

#### Market History
- The Gyroscope Protocol is live on Ethereum since EOY23, with E-CLPs on several other chains. Details available [here ](https://dune.com/gyro_finance/gyroscope-e-clps).
- This is the first wUSDM/ GYD pool

## Value
As per “Motivation”.

---

#### Contracts
- E-CLP: [0x315dd595e82bDc0c194f3A38A08fDE480D7E5d21](https://arbiscan.io/address/0x315dd595e82bDc0c194f3A38A08fDE480D7E5d21)
- Childchain gauge on Arbitrum: [0x879049Df2744B8D8848985C82275AD4c07379905](https://arbiscan.io/address/0x879049Df2744B8D8848985C82275AD4c07379905)
- Arbitrum Chain root gauge on Ethereum: [0x9eCc698c20219Ea45697d82ca89cD044aEEACF60](https://etherscan.io/address/0x9eCc698c20219Ea45697d82ca89cD044aEEACF60)

---

> Specification
>
> Transaction: The Balancer Maxi LM Multisig `eth:0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860` will interact with the GaugeAdderv4 at `0x5DbAd78818D4c8958EfF2d5b95b28385A22113Cd` and call the `addGauge` function with the following arguments:
>
> gauge(address): `0x9eCc698c20219Ea45697d82ca89cD044aEEACF60`
> gaugeType(string): `Arbitrum`

choices: No, this is not the way

raw.title: [BIP-683] Enable gauge for aGHO/USDe E-CLP [Arbitrum]
raw.author: 0x7019Be4E4eB74cA5F61224FeAf687d2b43998516
raw.body:
### PR with Payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/1268

### Summary

This is a proposal to enable one uncapped Balancer gauge on Arbitrum for an aGHO/USDe E-CLP. 

### References/Useful links

* [Documentation of E-CLPs](https://docs.gyro.finance/gyroscope-protocol/concentrated-liquidity-pools/e-clps)
* [Website](https://gyro.finance/)
* [Github](https://github.com/gyrostable)
* [Discord](https://discord.com/invite/2vnqnS7wE6)
* [X](https://twitter.com/GyroStable)

---

### Protocol description

* aGHO is the deposit receipt token issued by the Aave protocol to lenders of GHO. Since aTokens are rebasing, this pool uses BGD Labs’s statA wrapper that is a repricing representation of statA tokens that reflects the accruing lending yield. GHO is issued by [Aave](https://app.aave.com/).
* USDe is a "delta-neutral synthetic dollar" issued by [Ethena](https://ethena.fi/).

---

### Motivation

Gyroscope is launching further strategic pools.

---

### Specifications

#### Governance

The Gyroscope Protocol will be governed by a DAO and relevant stakeholder with the full launch on Ethereum. For now, the FTL Labs multi-sig can pause the pool, change the swap fee and set the protocol fee. As a custom pool by Gyroscope, the E-CLP will be controlled by Gyroscope governance upon its launch.

#### Oracles

* ‘rateProvider0’ for aGHO: [0x177862A0242acD8b5F9cc757a963c1C8883da45E](https://arbiscan.io/address/0x177862A0242acD8b5F9cc757a963c1C8883da45E) and relevant [review](https://github.com/balancer/code-review/blob/main/rate-providers/statATokenLMRateProvider.md).
* ‘rateProvider1’ for USDe: 0x0000000000000000000000000000000000000000

#### Audits

Audit reports by Nethermind, Trail of Bits, and Runtime Verification can be accessed here (the E-CLP is called the “CEMM” in these reports). In addition, the E-CLP code has been live in production since November 2022.

#### Centralization vectors

No centralization vectors. The FTL Labs team’s multi-sig can - currently - pause the pool, change the swap fee and set the protocol fee.

#### Market History

* The Gyroscope Protocol is live on Ethereum since EOY23, with E-CLPs on several other chains. Details available [here ](https://dune.com/gyro_finance/gyroscope-e-clps).
* This is the first aGHO/ USDe E-CLP.

## Value

As per “Motivation”.

---

#### Contracts
* E-CLP: [0x38161e9eFb8De52D00A1eB0f773223FD28FDd7c2](https://arbiscan.io/address/0x38161e9eFb8De52D00A1eB0f773223FD28FDd7c2)
* Child gauge on Arbitrum: [0xcfab2efeF3aFfdd158568DC896115Eac26B3C498](https://arbiscan.io/address/0xcfab2efeF3aFfdd158568DC896115Eac26B3C498)
* Arbitrum root gauge on Ethereum: [0xD558C611B69a223767788B638717E868D8947Fd0](https://etherscan.io/address/0xD558C611B69a223767788B638717E868D8947Fd0)

---

Specification

Transaction: The Balancer Maxi LM Multisig `eth:0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860` will interact with the gaugeAdderv4 at `0x5DbAd78818D4c8958EfF2d5b95b28385A22113Cd `and call the `addGauge` function with the following arguments:

* gauge(address): `0xD558C611B69a223767788B638717E868D8947Fd0`
* gaugeType(string): `Arbitrum`

choices: No, this is not the way

raw.title: [BIP-641] Enable wstETH/WETH E-CLP gauge [Arbitrum]
raw.author: 0x7019Be4E4eB74cA5F61224FeAf687d2b43998516
raw.body:
### PR with Payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/1101

### Summary 
This is a proposal to enable one uncapped Balancer gauge for a wstETH/WETH E-CLP on Arbitrum with Core Pool status.

### References/Useful links
* [Documentation of E-CLPs](https://docs.gyro.finance/gyroscope-protocol/concentrated-liquidity-pools/e-clps)
* [Website](https://gyro.finance/)
* [Github](https://github.com/gyrostable)
* [Discord](https://discord.com/invite/2vnqnS7wE6)
* [X](https://twitter.com/GyroStable)

---

### Protocol description
* "wstETH is a wrapped version of stETH. [..] wstETH keeps your balance of stETH fixed and uses an underlying share system to reflect your staking rewards." - [Lido](https://help.lido.fi/en/articles/5231836-what-is-lido-s-wsteth)
* WETH is an ERC-20 compliant wrapper of ETH.
---

### Motivation
Gyroscope is further expanding on Arbitrum. This pool is replacing a previously deployed E-CLP for the same assets and is calibrated to have a better fitting liquidity shape.

---

### Specifications
#### Governance
The Gyroscope Protocol will be governed by a DAO and relevant stakeholder with the full launch on Ethereum. For now, the FTL Labs multi-sig can pause the pool, change the swap fee and set the protocol fee. As a custom pool by Gyroscope, the E-CLP will be controlled by Gyroscope governance upon its launch.

 #### Oracles
- 'rateProvider0': wstETH rate provider on Arbitrum: [0xf7c5c26B574063e7b098ed74fAd6779e65E3F836](https://arbiscan.io/address/0xf7c5c26B574063e7b098ed74fAd6779e65E3F836)
-  'rateProvider1': WETH rate provider on Arbitrum: 0x00

#### Audits
Audit reports by Nethermind, Trail of Bits, and Runtime Verification can be accessed here (the E-CLP is called the “CEMM” in these reports). In addition, the E-CLP code has been live in production on Polygon since November 2022.

#### Centralization vectors
No centralization vectors. The FTL Labs team’s multi-sig can - currently - pause the pool, change the swap fee and set the protocol fee.

#### Market History
- The Gyroscope Protocol is live on Ethereum since EOY23, with E-CLPs on several other chains. Details available [here ](https://dune.com/gyro_finance/gyroscope-e-clps).
- wstETH and WETH already have markets on Balancer and other DEXes, but without the capital efficiency of an E-CLP.

## Value
As per “Motivation”.

---

#### Contracts
- E-CLP: [0x7967FA58B9501600D96bD843173b9334983EE6E6](https://arbiscan.io/address/0x7967FA58B9501600D96bD843173b9334983EE6E6)
- Childchain gauge on Arbitrum: [0x96d7C70c80518Ee189CB6ba672FbD22E4fDD9c19](https://arbiscan.io/address/0x96d7C70c80518Ee189CB6ba672FbD22E4fDD9c19)
- Arbitrum Chain root gauge on Ethereum: [0x3ABa56CeC68987963566a9AA93bb7f7DD28De3F5](https://etherscan.io/address/0x3ABa56CeC68987963566a9AA93bb7f7DD28De3F5)

---

> Specification
>
> Transaction: The Balancer Maxi LM Multisig `eth:0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860` will interact with the GaugeAdderv4 at `0x5DbAd78818D4c8958EfF2d5b95b28385A22113Cd` and call the `addGauge` function with the following arguments:
>
> gauge(address): `0x3ABa56CeC68987963566a9AA93bb7f7DD28De3F5`
> gaugeType(string): `Arbitrum`

choices: No, this is not the way

decision.summary: Proposal to enable an uncapped Balancer gauge on Arbitrum for a wstETH/GYD E-CLP, supported by a stable timeline of unanimous 'Yes' votes, with historical precedent of similar proposals passing and resulting in positive TVL and token price impacts.
key_arguments_for: Unanimous voting support with stable lead ratios across all quartiles indicates strong community consensus.
Historical similar proposals enabled strategic liquidity pools and gauges with positive market impact and TVL growth.
The gauge will support Gyroscope's stablecoin and wstETH liquidity, improving protocol value and utility.
No centralization risks identified; multi-sig control is standard and transition to DAO governance is planned.
key_arguments_against: Forum sentiment is limited with only two comments, one negative raising concerns about multisig control and centralization, and one neutral linking to the proposal.
Small voter turnout (5 voters) limits the breadth of engagement.
Some community concern about multisig control in the short term before full DAO governance.

evidence.quote: First comment raises multisig control and centralization concerns (negative sentiment); second comment is a neutral link to the proposal.
5 votes, unanimous 'Yes, let's do it' choice, stable lead ratio and early vote ratio of 1.0 indicating strong and consistent support.
Similar prior proposal enabling gauge for GYD/wstETH on Arbitrum passed unanimously and resulted in 12.69% price increase and 3.65% TVL growth post-vote.

available_choices: No, this is not the way
decision.ai_final_conclusion: Option 'Yes, let's do it' selected with stance to keep 'Change'.
decision.ai_final_reason:
- The voting timeline shows unanimous and stable support for enabling the gauge, with all votes cast for 'Yes, let's do it'.
- Similar historical proposals to enable GYD/wstETH gauges on Arbitrum passed with unanimous support and led to positive token price and TVL growth, supporting the proposal's value proposition.
- Forum sentiment is limited and slightly negative due to concerns about multisig control; however, the recommendation aligns with the vote outcome and prioritizes long-term protocol benefits over short-term centralization concerns.
- Market impact metrics indicate positive token price and TVL growth, reinforcing the proposal's expected positive effect.
Overall, the recommendation is to change by enabling the gauge, which reflects the strong vote consensus and builds on successful precedent, while acknowledging the minor forum concerns which do not outweigh the benefits.
